author: travellergy68
title: Positive home birth
body:
We gave birth at home on the 12th of November. I had anxiety about the birth nearer the end of pregnancy due to a bad experience with an anaesthetist. I was never an at risk during pregnancy, yet he made me feel as if my choices about my body were wrong. The phonecall I recieved from the anaethsetist was after the consultant agreed to support me and my decision.  
I was 35 weeks pregnant by this point and did not need the stress. The support I received from the community midwives was outstanding though. They were supportive and helped ease my anxiety. The majority of my appointments were with one midwife and the continuity helped me so much. They listened to me and helped me to have confidence in myself and that it is ok to trust my own body. They had agreed to be on call for me for my planned home birth. One could not attend in the end but her boss came instead.  
It meant everything that in every step of the way they trusted me to be in tune with my body, and in turn this helped me have the phsiological birth I dreamed of having at home with no interventions. We feel very grateful to have had the midwives we had at our home, and it made our experience so positive in the end. I dread to think how badly I would have been feeling right now had I listened to other people, rather than trusting my own body to do what it was made to do.  
Thank you so much to the Hawick community midwives. They are heroes to us.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Lynchie60
title: Outstanding care
body:
I received a Colonoscopy from Dr Bayaty's team. One word describes my time and treatment under their care - " outstanding ". The attention to detail, professionalism and standard of care provided does your facility proud.  
We are lucky to have such outstanding professionals at our disposal providing a world class service. At these difficult times the level of care is breathtaking. Thank you for my treatment today. Be proud, be very proud

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: OctopusSticker
title: Reassuring service
body:
So after coming back with Hpv positive for the third smear test, I was called in for a colposcopy. I'm not going to lie I was so scared. Unfortunately the ward was busy as mad on the day. The staff did the absolute best they could to keep people comfortable and happy, but I was anxious as hell. After a hour of waiting and feeling for the non stop staff, I was called in and informed they were investigating abnormal cells. After getting into position and staring at the screen the gino informed me they would need to take a biopsy.  
I'm not going to lie, I lost my Â£hit, panicked like crazy and refused the biopsy. At this point I can't thank the nurses enough, they are honestly beautiful people. I was rescheduled an appointment for a few weeks time. I returned. After waiting an hour for the staff, (they was rushed off their feet) I went In and had the nerve for the biopsy! And I hate to say it! I felt nothing!!! If I hadn't heard the noise I wouldn't of known it had happened. Seriously, thank you Harry and the nurses, you are beautiful people and souls, you deserve all the praise in the world.. thank you ðŸ–¤

author: Nanma
title: Reassuring Day surgery
body: I had day surgery for breast cancer in November. I was very scared due to an unfortunate experience when waking up during a previous op many years ago. I would like praise the nurse Ruth and the anesthetist, Tim, who were incredibly kind and understanding, supportive. and reassuring. Please would you pass my thanks and appreciation on to them and all the staff who were just lovely.

author: piscesjx95
title: Excellent care and nursing team
body:
I attended Causeway Hospital ED at the end of October 21 with severe abdominal pain, having had surgery a few weeks beforehand. I know there is a lot of publicity about overcrowded EDs and people waiting for a very long time in ED, but within a few hours I was admitted to Surgical 2 ward, and was receiving treatment.  
I had felt very poorly and was in a great deal of pain, and it was such a relief to start to feel better on the 3rd day of my admission.  
The nursing team were excellent, all with a very caring and professional manner. In particular the night staff were so helpful and kind as they did their observations through the night. The Health Care Assistants and ancillary staff need to be singled out for special praise. The ward was very clean, the food was more than good, and their energy and positive and jokey manner lifted everyone's spirits.  
I as discharged on day 5, was home for lunch, and and well recovered now.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: liberatorcm57
title: Incredible and professional care
body:
We received incredible and professional care at PRM, at every point of care.  
Maternity assessment, the labour ward and ward 68 were absolutely exceptional. Their care made an uncertain and anxious time into a really positive experience.  
Rachael and student midwife Skye in the labour ward I felt went above and beyond for us, and made sure that we were well informed and comfortable. We didnâ€™t have an expectation about what the experience would be like as we are first time parents, but I hope that everyone gets to experience such good care when they have their babies! The senior midwifery staff, medics and theatre team were also wonderful, and all made a potential traumatic experience just part of our story!  
Miya and the staff in ward 68 took great care of us too, and the night staff were very supportive when I felt like the world was upside down with a new screaming baby. While I was happy to go home, it was the best environment to be in for support and a lot of TLC, despite the staff being so busy.  
We are eternally grateful for the care received- itâ€™s easy to have a moan but we genuinely donâ€™t have a bad word to say about anything!

author: The big breenger
title: Skillful Eye Surgery
body:
My first ever visit to Vale of Leven Hospital was in Nov 2021, for eye surgery, to remove a blister type growth from my left eye, having seen the eye surgeon, Mr Tejwani, at the RAH, just a couple of weeks previously. The growth was removed from the corner of my left eye, with no pain and very little discomfort.  
I would like to offer my heartfelt thanks to Mr Tejwani and all the nurses in the theatre area, for their skill and for the manner in which I was treated and spoken to. Also my thanks to nurse Anne, who looked after me, on entry to the day ward and after my surgery and to all in our NHS. Thank you from a grateful patient

author: Upsnb49
title: Unprofessional Reception staff
body:
When I arrived at clinic I rang bell a very surly person came and in a not very professional way asked what I wanted. I told them that I had an appointment, and was told in a very unprofessional way to take a seat . It was like I had disturbed someone's tea break. I feel they need some sort of reception training.  
The nurse who came and collected and carried out the procedure was excellent and introduced herself and explained what was happening , and had a very nice manner.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Dunkeld lodge
title: Life saving ambulance response
body:
My child was unresponsive @ home on Sunday morning due to a hypoglycaemic episode related to diabetes. The quick response, action, treatment and support given to my husband & child by the Bonnyrigg paramedic crew was excellent. Unfortunately I wasnâ€™t home at the time and I just want to say Thank You for saving my sons life.  
Please could you locate the ambulance crew and give them this feed back.  
One eternally grateful mum .

author: BCDE
title: Vaccination
body:
First, I want to thank the lovely people at my local vaccination centre here in Fife. My problem relates to procedures, not people. The people are great, and I am pleased to have had my covid booster jag.  
Last week general booking for covid booster jags opened here in Scotland for my age cohort (40-49 year olds). We were encouraged to use the NHS website to book a booster jag at any time from 24 weeks after the second dose. I did so immediately, for a date 24 weeks to the day from my second dose.  
Yesterday, the JCVI brought this forward to three months following the second dose, in the face of the omicron variant. I immediately rescheduled my appointment, finding one available in walking distance the following day.  
I did have the sense, given the line of questioning at reception, that I was in some way jumping the queue - in spite of bookings being open for my age cohort and very specific advice from the JCVI. The receptionist was great about it, and I think there was a sense in which she had to tick a box on the computer, but I was very uncomfortable.  
I am autistic, so I am perhaps oversensitive to the suggestion that I have done something wrong, because this happens all the time, but my reading of the situation is that I was following the advice of the Health Secretary, the National Clinical Director (who is presumably advising the Health Secretary) and the JCVI.  
I see no information to the effect that I should wait for a specific invitation, as was the case for my first two doses. Official advice, including the NHS website, seemed very clear that I should use my initiative, but I was, as mentioned, left with the impression that I should have waited until some unspecified time in the future.  
I understand that the present situation seems to be leading to changes on an almost daily basis, but I would hate for this kind of incident to lead to a situation where people are left disinclined to request vaccination, so perhaps something needs to be done about these procedures.  
To add to the suggestion that there is a problem with procedures, I have just, six hours *after* my appointment, received email confirmation of it.  
This is not a complaint. I am not upset with the receptionist, who presumably had a box to tick, but if I did something wrong by following what I thought was official vaccination advice (and it's certainly true that I often misinterpret the way neurotypicals think and act), then the advice needs to be clarified. If I didn't, then the line of questioning needs to be changed in order to reflect that.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: SBara
title: Community Therapy services
body:
My husband has MS and is unable to walk, He uses a wheelchair.  
He can walk 5 to 10 steps with stick.  
His left side is powerless and numb. We are so thankful for the therapist that Edgware community hospital has sent for him .

author: marchqr87
title: Ambulance service went above and beyond
body: My husband took unwell suddenly this afternoon. I called 999 as he was unconscious. The rapid response from the Scottish ambulance service was fantastic. I cannot praise the paramedics and technicians enough. They were professional, but empathetic and very reassuring. Especially a thanks to Aime snd Sarah who went above and beyond for our family. Thank you so very much and well done NHS.

author: rainbb76
title: Covid Testing Pod
body:
Thank you to the team in the CAH covid testing pod! As a staff member I attend for weekly PRC covid swabs.. Staff are always so friendly and welcoming!  
From the booking team to the swabbing staff.. well done!! A really well organised and efficient service you provide.. thank you for your hard work itâ€™s very much appreciated in keeping staff and our patients safe!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hadarsk44
title: There are no appointments
body:
I have waited 6 weeks for a phone consultation - what am I supposed to do?  
I waited for my 2 hour phone call time slot, 1 hour either side of the set time, no phone until 2.30 later.  
I tried to book an appointment online - nothing available  
I think this is a poor service

author: Blunny
title: Craigavon area Hospital
body:
I came to a very busy- or as the doctors remarked; approaching meltdown, Emergency Department. I was told I would be staying and directed to a bench seat along the corridor in early afternoon. By midnight, both myself and the other 5 patients were very uncomfortable. I was in considerable pain and was getting as much pain relief as was allowed on a bench seat by the red CDU area- holding all Covid patients. The night shift staff nurse grabbed any trolley that had just finished being used and got us on as she was so upset that we were all due surgery - on the emergency lists and on bench seats.  
Because I was on a trolley, the next morning, I still was unable to receive iv morphine as the nurse on duty stated I wasnâ€™t safe enough being on a trolley in the corridor. The staff were truly busy and, with no ward bed available, I was rolling around my trolley until the afternoon when I was brought up to 4 North.  
I received immediate iv pain relief and, although I still had a couple of days wait for surgery, I was much more comfortable. My day nurse for Wednesday through to Friday was Sheena, an extremely empathetic and professional staff nurse. She was my advocate when I was unable to have a conversation with the consultant, she was my advocate when I went for my operation but was sent back as my allergies had been overlooked and the operating theatre required a latex clean.  
Sheena really looked after me and that care had such an impact. I was treated as me- an individual who, during that time was the most important person to her. I also watched her dry a patientsâ€™ hair who was post op. Sheena deserves thanks and recognition for her care. Alongside was a mature 2nd year student nurse from Omagh - Roland?? He was a man who used his initiative and, although his second day there, alerted staff when an observation reading required immediate action. When a case of Covid happened in the bay next to me, the cleaning staff were fast and thorough.  
After my operation, the Reg agreed to my remaining overnight. The following day, my consultant wanted me to go home that afternoon. I knew I was unwell and the weekend staff agreed- they spoke to the senior member of staff, and I remained. That night I developed sepsis and the night nurse - with light red hair who had already been concerned the previous night about sepsis by my obs, worked quickly with the doctor to bring down a heart rate in the high 200â€™s as well as low bp and very high temp. They were reassuring but very efficient.  
The next day - Sunday, my consultant advised me I had sepsis and I had a catheter inserted by a very reassuring nurse. I was nervous, very ill and worried. The staff were calm and reassuring. That same day one of my swabs gave a positive Covid result. The staff nurse was apologetic but explained I would now be transferred to a Covid ward 3 north. To say I was worried was an understatement. I should not as staff like Grainne were efficient and supportive throughout the remainder of my 2 week stay. The most terrific medical team are in 3north. EhJay the friendly consultant- who took the time you required to discuss your case with you and my favourite Nigerian reg who was always in the ward. She took time to sit with patients, encourage them to eat or take their pills and had the most infectious laugh. She was great at getting blood from arms so covered in bruises that veins were illusive. There were many other day and night staff who were also terrific on 3north like Amanda? I really appreciated the fact that nursing staff continued to be advocates for patients when busy surgical teams did not always see the whole patient- this I also observed in 3north.  
Finally, my terrible veins caused issues and I required anaesthetics to come down with a scanner twice finally putting in a mid-line instead of a cannula. The lady was lovely and very reassuring, explaining all throughout. Also two ladies from the phlebotomy dept I believe one was M Brennan - noted as the best there is, made my final cannula insertions so much less uncomfortable and achieved first time! I am at home and very slowly recovering now.  
I know that quick responses and amazing staff made a huge difference to my stay and, quite frankly, my life during my stay.  
Thankyou Craigavon.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Henwf97
title: Outstanding care
body:
I was advised by my GP to attend the minor injuries department as I had a UTI Infection. My heart rate had started to race and my blood pressure as well.  
I arrived and was taken straight away where my bloods were sent off and a urine sample as well.  
A few hours later a lovely young doctor spoke to me about my situation and said I would need to be admitted. She kept apologising on not seeing me sooner. Under no circumstances did she keep me waiting any longer than necessary. This Assessment Unit is run off its feet. The Nursing Staff and Doctors are run off their feet and still manage to smile.  
I was admitted to B6 that evening with an air pressure mattress which is essential for me as I am in bed permanently.  
The care that I received in B6 was outstanding. All the Staff and Doctors made sure I was well cared for and received the relevant treatment.  
Would like to say thanks to them all for taking such great care of me.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Perjt57
title: Caring Adult Psychological Therapies
body:
I canâ€™t find the words to describe my gratitude for this service. I began attending aged 49 with 40 + years of traumatic events that I had buried deep away and then menopause had tipped me over the edge and brought it all to the surface. I struggled every day with the simplest of tasks and felt overwhelmed to the point of incapacity and felt I was slowly losing more of me each day. I felt hopeless and helpless and didnâ€™t want to communicate or have any contact with anyone, I wanted to be alone in my bedroom most nights.  
This is where Jenny comes in. She straight away put me at ease and I felt I could tell her anything. Very quickly she had me down to a tee and it felt like she knew me better than I knew myself. Her caring manner professionalism and intuition were first class and whilst I knew the journey was going to be excruciatingly difficult, I knew it was going to be okay in the end because I trusted her completely and knew I was in safe hands.  
She was always caring compassionate and understanding and never pushed too far but also knew when to accelerate when needed. Sometimes I felt she had a crystal ball because she always â€œjust knewâ€ and would say the right thing.  
Fast forward 18 months and I feel like a new person. Everything in my life is better because I am better and thatâ€™s all thanks to Jenny. No more isolating myself to avoid people, a lot less aches and pains because my body isnâ€™t stiff from anxiety and stress, I have found out I quite like myself and feel very proud of myself instead of feeling disgusted by myself and feeling unworthy of my place on earth. My whole outlook has changed and my coping capacity is humongous now.  
I will practice self care regularly and check in with myself on a regular basis. I wish I had done this sooner but better late than never and they do say life begins at 50; mine certainly has thanks to Jenny.  
I do hope Jennyâ€™s manager will see this. I am sure she already knows what a superstar she has in Jenny but I honestly cannot find the words to explain the difference she made in my life and in turn all my families life as I know they are so happy with the better improved version of me they have now, so please praise her as highly as you can, she is worth her weight in gold.

author: IainKB
title: Comfortable and reassuring surgery
body:
This was my second visit to Leicester as previous admission date was cancelled after I arrived due to unavailability of ICU / HDU beds which would be a requirement after my scheduled operation. This almost happened again but, thank goodness an ICU bed was secured at last moment so operation was able to proceed. I has become quite nervous  about the procedure due to the long wait but was reassured by surgeon, anaesthetist & ward staff who all showed fortitude, empathy & understanding under difficult circumstances; i.e. the uncertainty of beds being available due to highly busy times.
Operation went ahead & throughout the pre-operation procedures; e.g. fitting of epidural tubes etc., all theatre staff were cheerful & supportive helping to alleviate my worries.
Nest thing I remember is waking up in recovery where staff were immediately available to reassure me that all had gone to plan & that I was going to be OK.
I had been worried that I would be feeling very sore & uncomfortable but the pain relief measures were superb & I just felt sleepy & comfortable.
After 3 days I was transferred onto a ward where I continued to be kept comfortable and reassured. 
Ward staff were all good, some outstanding, as were physio's & the Stoma Nurses. I had a few difficult days where I felt a bit depressed & had appetite issues but staff did all they could to be encouraging.
There seemed to be a lot of different doctors / consultants etc. who came round over the next several days but I was happy with the information they gave to me & with their attitudes & confidence that I would soon be better & would be able to cope with some necessary lifestyle changes.
Having come through a major procedure I am just thankful that we have such skills available within the NHS; ie. the skill of the surgeons & the professional yet friendly skills of all nursing & other support staff. My heartfelt thanks to all of you at Leicester General Hospital Urology department.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: Riddlemethis
title: Wonderful asset to the NHS
body:
I was very anxious about my urology appointment due to ongoing symptoms and just the experience of having a procedure that was quite invasive. As soon as I arrived at Urology I was given a kind and friendly welcome from ALL of the staff and this carried on all the way through to my leaving the department which made my visit as pleasant an experience as it could have been given the nature of the appointment.  
All of the staff were kind compassionate and are a wonderful asset to the NHS. We are lucky to have them

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: JimC3661
title: Excellent ambulance crew & ED staff
body:
I had a bad fall this morning at home and needed to call the Ambulance service. Less than 10 minutes later the crew arrived. Manus & Colin were fantastic throughout from settling me to their assessment, treatment and transfer to the ED. Both are an absolute credit to the service!  
On arrival in the ED I was promptly triaged and despite the wait (ED busy as usual but this is to be expected) I was assessed by Daniel, one of the ED doctors and then had xrays. Both Daniel and the team in Xray were fantastic. Daniel was able to identify a more significant injury than first thought but communicated and explained this really clearly, putting me at ease. Like the NIAS Crew the ED staff were excellent.  
These staff reflect so well on all of the professionals in the wider health service! Well done!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: ariesrise31
title: Concern about discharge arrangements
body:
My gran was admitted to FVRH A&E late evening due to having two unwitnessed falls that she could not remember. There was also concern that her blood pressure was extremely high for someone with no history of blood pressure problems. My gran was put into a trolley in A&E, nursing staff who were very kind to my gran and myself were coming in to do basic observational checks on her, due to her blood pressure still being high, throughout the night until the Dr came in at 07:30 (almost 8 hours after she was admitted to the department).  
My first concern is that despite the nursing and auxiliary staff being lovely, although I understand they were very busy, at no point did anyone offer my gran anything to drink, when my gran required to use the toilet (on multiple occasions) she was offered the use of a commode the first time by an auxiliary who assisted her but after this it was left to myself to assist her. This was very upsetting to my gran as she is a proud, and private, woman. I do appreciate that the department and staff are very busy, but if I had not been there with her she would never have spoken up as she doesn't like to bother anyone.  
When the Dr came to assess my gran he was very thorough in his questioning, I appreciated that he took my views and concerns into account as my gran had become a little more confused of late. However, when I spoke to him of my concern about her blood pressure being high (at one point her reading was 232/109 and did not decrease much lower than this throughout her admission) the Dr told me he was not overly concerned about her readings and suspected that her blood pressure would normalise on its own. I found this hard to agree with as she is over 80 with some underlying health conditions and to have a consistently high blood pressure for a sustained period of time is not good for her. However, the Dr agreed that she would need to be admitted for further observations and physio referrals due to her unexplained falls.  
It was almost 6+ hours, a move from A&E to a holding bed in treatments whilst awaiting a bed in a ward, a visit from the physio and another Dr before we were advised that my gran was in fact not going to be admitted (despite her blood pressure still being high), she was to be sent home with some house aids, a referral was to be made for her to get a MECS alarm system installed and advised to contact her own GP with regards to her blood pressure. No discussion about medication management for her blood pressure, discharged with the advice that due to her age that she needs to be more careful.  
Thankfully we were able to get an appointment with her own GP quite quickly, he checked her blood pressure and unsurprisingly it had not gotten better, in fact it was even higher than before . Her GP immediately admitted her to her local hospital (Royal Alexandria Hospital, Paisley) where she was kept for 2 days, monitored and medicated until her blood pressure returned to within a normal limit, discharged with medications and follow up with her own medical practice.  
It is gravely concerning that an elderly woman was allowed to be discharged from FVRH with consistently high blood pressure which could have caused life changing harm, if not lost her her life if left untreated.

author: bwbcobffs
title: Access to Mental Health services
body:
I was in hospital twice over the last week with mental health problems. I had an appointment with community team in a month but they were unable to bring it forward so they directed me to the out of hours SPA phone line who directed me to 111.  
On both occasions I saw a member of the Liaison Psych Team. Both times I was told that it was the responsibility of the CMHT to see me, which would have been fine except afterwards I received discharge letters that I do not believe they communicate the facts. As well as small details being incorrect (e.g. my date of birth and my race), their account of what I said does not reflect my memory of the conversation- in fact at times they had often written the exact opposite to what I said.  
The whole experience has left me feeling even more frustrated with the system as I just do not believe I am going to receive the help I need. I have been bounced around the system for over ten years now and do not understand why I cannot be helped. The only people I have seen receive proper mental health treatment are those who have severely harmed themselves in such a way that is long term or those who harm others. Rightly, those people should take priority, however it must be said that when you have to get to that point to actually receive proper help, the system is surely broken.

author: chamaeleonmc97
title: Outstanding care
body:
On Monday I was in the very capable hands of the Breast surgical theatre team at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary headed by the experienced and efficient Mr Bourne and his team who since my tumour was detected by the Breast Screening service have been marvellous throughout, and very efficient at getting the correct care in place.  
Like other departments and staff at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary they are working at full capacity and they are an example of how the NHS should be fully functioning throughout the pandemic unlike the falling standard of primary care I have had the misfortune to experience elsewhere.  
I was anxious about surgery but the empathetic Mr Bourne put me at ease prior to surgery with a quick visit accompanied by junior colleagues who hopefully will follow the good example of patient care set by Mr Bourne who is retiring soon.  
From my admission to the department of scheduled admissions where Nurse Lorraine was reassuring, the injection room at Nuclear Medicine where both staff were calm and reassuring to the entire team in the Surgical Theatre who helped Mr Bourne I sincerely thank all of you for the outstanding care I received as you are a credit to the NHS working at full capacity.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: chamaeleonmc97
title: A great service working under pressure
body:
From the start of my diagnosis and further tests at the Breast Unit I have felt nothing other than relief that this department in Aberdeen Royal Infirmary is working efficiently despite being at full capacity through the pandemic.  
From my initial recall in late September and MacMillan Nurse Linda giving me advice followed by the next appointments in October where I was reassured by Nurse Susan and Dr Alice who did my ultrasound and other procedures I can only say thank you and continue your great service under pressure seeing the department is so busy.  
It is a relief that the NHS is working well when you need it.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Excellent practice
body:
Even before the start of the pandemic, Leiston Surgery provided an excellent service to the local community.
Throughout the past 20 months of the pandemic, the service has been outstanding and the organisation of all the Covid immunisations and flu jabs has been first class.
There has never been a problem in getting to talk to or seeing any member of the medical staff, we are just so fortunate to have this excellent surgery in Leiston

title: Just wonderful
body: The kindest, gentlest, and most informative nurses for my coil insertion. When it went a bit pear shaped (I felt very faint) they could not have been kinder, even bringing me a cup of tea and caterpillar cake and consistently checking on me for the next 1hr30. Could not have made me more comfortable or feel better looked after.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great and comfortable practice
body: I have been under 2 doctors at this practice for the last 6 years, I always feel listened to by the doctors and staff, I am always made comfortable and understood,  I would highly recommend this practice to anyone, would not change practice to anywhere else. thank you  your caring doctors and staff

title: top notch practice
body: I have been a patient for about 3 years now ,apart from a misunderstanding.the drs and nurses and reception etc have looked after me far better than my last health centre ,showing genuine care.politeness,understanding and as I have numerouse illnesses and now wear hearing aids are patient with me so I can get the help and /or advice I need.They do their utmost best to help when needed and have cared for my health and disabliities from day one .I am SO pleased to be a patient and I am very grateful for them taking care of me .thankyou to all who work at lytham road surgery.Good health care like this is hard to find.I am glad I finally found a practice that does.

title: Great practice
body: Always been helpful. Have been seen on same day when called or within 24 hours. Always been happy with the service I have received for nearly 25 years.

title: Helpful & kind.
body: I emailed Clerkenwell Medical Practice explaining an unfortunate situation -  their response, support and help was exemplary.  I had been due to fly home (overseas) to reunite with my family for the first time in 2 years, but unexpectedly tested positive for COVID19 - meaning I couldn't travel. When I emailed, explaining the situation and requesting help, a nurse from Clerkenwell MP called me back almost immediately - offering her support at a very difficult time. She was kind, personable and reassuring. Following my ten days of isolation, she willingly assisted me with forms and medical clearance certificates. I am very grateful to this particular staff member, along with 2 doctors who also provided help.

title: Hospital staff
body: The staff on the wards Iâ€™ve been in are marvellous, they have so much to do with do little staff, they all need a pay on the back. They work extremely long hours and donâ€™t get the praise they deserve, McMillan nurses are lovely, caring and very helpful, I have nothing but deep respect for these people

title: Useless surgery
body:
To book at an appointment here you have to call at 8am every single time I call at 8am on the dot thereâ€™s not a single appointment available each time Iâ€™m given a link to an e consultation which then tells me to call my surgery back as the symptoms are severe. 
I call back and they refuse to give an appointment telling me to call 111 and sit waiting for 4hours plus. This happens each time.

 Iâ€™ve had sick children and they never have a appointment available and refuse to book for another day. 
Iâ€™m expected to call on the day at 8am which I do and get an appointment on that same day and each time thereâ€™s nothing available even though I call in first. 
Thereâ€™s been times where theyâ€™ve even cut me off. 
 By far the worst doctors Iâ€™ve come across and the receptionists are extremely rude and useless. 

They have three branches and itâ€™s the same at each surgery. 
They are meant to help sick patients I donâ€™t understand what there sat there for. Literally to pick up the phone and so no appointments available call back tomorrow at 8am and repeat that sentence every day. 
I rang for a week straight at 8am on the dot I canâ€™t ring any earlier and still they refused to help. 
And when I do that itâ€™s a repeat of the same thing. 
If you register with this doctor expect nothing no help no appointments. 
To sum it up this surgery is completely  useless. They should just shut down wonâ€™t make any difference. 
They donâ€™t help sick patients.

title: Poor practice
body:
Rude secretary they don't have empathy. They feel they are the Doctors. 
I couldn't get support for repeat prescription. 
They showed a don't care attitude

title: Bad manners, very rude and unhelpful
body: I called giffard drive surgery today with regards to an appointment they made me that I was not able to attend, the manner and rudeness of the receptionist was horrendous to say the least. She wouldn't allow me to get a telephone appointment with my doctor then put the phone down on me.. unbelievable service, you should be ashamed of yourselves

title: Warm personable reception staff leading the way !
body:
This practice I have been privileged to attend for over two decades .
The care attention and professionalism of the staff I cannot commend enough!
The reception team are outstanding in the conscientious care and professionalism that they exhibit whenever I have made contact with the surgery via phone or email .
Any query thatâ€™s proposed is followed through immediatelyâ€¦with a courteous immediate response often by email or telephone call ,then always followed by a solution to your concern or query and linking you with the particular clinician of your choice .

I have only ever had exemplary care from the Drs at this practice â€¦proactive with any potential health issue that may be classified as urgent,whilst also providing detailed care and attention for non urgent issues .
I shall always be significantly grateful to the Oakleigh Road Clinic in house family .

title: Good nursing home
body: Our mum has been their for 6 months and she is very happy in their and staff are lovely and cheerful

title: Super staff
body: Working under great pressure all the staff I've dealt with at this medical centre have been unfailingly polite, cheerful, and helpful. Both my covid vaccinations and my ongoing care related to my chronic condition have been delivered as well as I could wish for. Thanks to all involved :)

title: Very good
body: Efficient and caring nurse. Showed competency throughout my visit. It was reassuring and although it was a short visit I didn't feel rushed.

title: Great practice with efficient staff.
body: I was recently diagnosed with a squamous cell carcinoma on my face. Following an operation to remove the growth at YDH, I attended the surgery 3 times to have the dressing checked and the stitches removed. I also needed to see the GP and NP at short notice to have an urgent prescription of antibiotics due to a wound infection. All the surgery team were very accommodating in arranging appointments at short notice and proffessional in the way they administered my treatment.

title: good teamwork & I felt confidence in the staff
body:
Had experienced the frustration of a previous cancellation & it nearly happened again as hospital was under severe bed strain on the day of my admission, however all was well in the end & my operation ( radical cystectomy) was able to proceed. The admission staff & surgeon / anaesthetist had all been to see me & were patient, happy to explain everything I asked about & ensured I was as well informed as possible. They were obviously as frustrated as I was with the critical beds situation which could have resulted in another cancellation plus waste of operating theatre & staff time. Staff remained cheerful & supportive throughout.
I was nervous as I went down to the theatre but staff were reassuring & told me I would be fine. I was well aware that this procedure is a major operation with risks but the staff kept me reassured throughout.
When I came round after the operation the staff around me in the HDU / ICU were there to once again reassure me & kept me pain free.
During the next 9 days of my stay I felt well looked after & have no issues with anything. Staff were helpful & pleasant - all staff - and stoma nurse & physiotherapists were all gentle, empathetic  & supportive.
Overall the number of doctors / consultants seen during my stay seemed quite a lot & I only saw my actual consultant once as I recall, but nevertheless I felt that they all wanted to see me improve & become mobile asap with a view to going home soonest but without any feeling that they wanted me out the way! I felt all had my best interests at the heart of what they did.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Accessible & friendly
body:
Thank you for continuing to make appointments bookable in advance both by phone and online despite the current pressures of Covid.  I am so grateful that unlike other local GP practices I do not have to compete to win an appointment phone race morning after morning with no guarantee of ever succeeding. 
Receptionists, nurses, and especially my GP have been uniformly helpful, knowledgeable and approachable.    Thank you

title: Excellent care
body: I was wonderfully looked after during my morning in endoscopy outpatients - receptionist, nurses and doctor that cared for me were lovely and reassured me. Thank you for taking the time to listen and answer any questions I had. We are so fortunate to have the NHS that offer this service for free.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: COVID vaccine
body:
My 17yr old son fainted twice after his vaccine, they dealt with it amazingly and gave him fantastic care. As a parent it was horrible to watch but they dealt with it so calmly and professionally it put me at ease.  
Well done and thank you to all involved.

title: Great first impression
body: The surgery got me in quickly (3 days from time of call to the appointment) and the entire experience was only 40 min from the time I walked in to left, which I consider fast and efficient. The doctor was extremely knowledge, empathetic, thorough, and made a next step plan. The technology was also impressive with the ability to text me more info from the click of a button on the computer. I am an American and this was my first GP experience in Britain. I was throughly impressed.

title: Excellent support
body: Thank you to the person who arranged the Covid vaccinations who listened to my concerns, ensured they were met, supported me when I arrived and helped me through the process.  You were fantastic, I couldn't have done it without you.  A Very Big Thankyou.

title: Great Practice
body:
We were met at the door by a professional and friendly gentleman who then directed us to the reception area and again I greated by lovely staff and offered a warm drink.
The whole process and procedure was conducted like clockwork by very professional and helpful staff.
Thank you  to all  the spamedica staff for giving me  such a very professional  caring  experience.

title: Great practice
body: Iâ€™ve been using this doctors surgery for years now at first it was really good then it did drop but everytime Iâ€™ve been in the receptionist are always helpful an the doctors. The receptionists get a lot of abuse but the always seem helpful to me an try their best. After all weâ€™re all human. Thank you to all the staff that have helped me over the years.

title: Great service
body:
Always get to book an urgent appointment as needed.
Admin staff had assisted me really well on both occassions when I was on the phone with him. He is very pleasant to speak with. He gives me all available option. Strongly recommended.

title: Fix your booking system
body: I did an E consultation for my child really need medication for an ongoing condition,  causing him many problems ,they gave me a phone call appointment for 2 weeks time ! That day was Today but no call was made I waited all day ,phoned the surgery at 4.30 in cue for nearly 2 hours got into position 2 and got cut off ,had tried to phone the day before as my son had a bad reaction to flu vacination  could even get in cue as it said we can not take your call right now this was at 8.30am ,gave up as I thought I was speaking to Dr today  no email no msg nothing

title: Great Service
body: Excellent visit to St Peters today. Great attention to detail from Doctor and exceptional help from receptionists when I asked them to sort something out for me.

title: Fast track excellence
body: A huge thank you to the Patient Transport Service and the RSH X-ray department for the friendly, helpful and super efficient service I received today when I attended for an x-ray . The whole experience, in every respect, was quite literally amazing. I canâ€™t thank you all enough.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Just like to say from the start to finish of my journey with team looking after me in Bolton I felt well looked after throughout All the staff were friendly and looked after me excellent very impressed

title: Overall Experience
body: This is the 3rd time I have submitted a review since technical issues prevented you seeing my first submission and hopefully I have not missed anything out. I went to LRI A&E on the evening of the 10th October 2021. Initial booking in was good but then the next step into the ambulatory department was not as easy and I lost about 30 minutes by not hearing my name called out. I am slightly deaf and when you arrive, you are given a number. On the 1st stage, the number flashes up if you haven't heard your name but on the 2nd stage nothing. Nurses were calling from behind the wall that formed the corridor into the department making it even more difficult. Calling by numbers would be easier to hear but maybe less personal but making the 2nd set of boards the same as the first would be better. Once through the doors, I couldn't fault the service. I was seen by a Clinical Practitioner who wasn't going to let me go until he/she fully understood what was wrong with me. None of this "just take paracetamol" and come back if it doesn't get better. He/she was intensely thorough. Blood tests, CT scan and X rays all done in the early hours of the morning, all by very friendly and professional staff. I was released from there at around 6.00am armed with antibiotics and clear instructions on the process going forward and what to do if various symptoms came back. Couldn't fault the service this time. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Rude
body: Called at 8am took 146 times to get through, asked for a specific GP as I have an on going problem and itâ€™s easier to speak to the same GP if possible to save explaining myself over and over again. Got told to call back at 2pm. Called at 1:59, got through straight away the receptionist then had me on the phone for 3 minutes and then told me that the doctor I asked for had no appointments. Well, if the appointments where â€œblockedâ€ at 8am and I had to call back at 2pm. Why when I was on the phone to the receptionist from 1:59 to 2:02 the slots had filled.. how when they were apparently â€œblockedâ€ until 2pm and I had been speaking to her since 1:59. She then says â€œwell thereâ€™s 2 people on the deskâ€ when I ask how the slots have filled that quick. Well, if you have an afternoon clinic telling patients to call at 2 there should be appointments available at 2. Therefore, I then told her to get a GP to call me and she said â€œwell answer the phoneâ€. To which I told her where I work has low signal, and the doctor I usually speak to is aware of this and understands so rings more than once if she canâ€™t get through at first. Not too sure why I have to speak to the receptionists quite harshly to get an appointment. A few weeks prior to this, I stood at the desk for 10 minutes whilst the 2 receptionists had a conversation amongst themselves, it would have probably been a longer wait only I asked them if they were going to see to me at any point.

title: No longer recommended
body:
When helping hands first started providing care for my parent 2018  there was a terrific management team and brilliant carers.   That changed in 2021 we have now terminated their service after many disappointing mistakes . Carers turned up very  late or sometimes not at all. Concerns about their abilities , no common sense.
Cleaning below average standard.
One carer who shall be missed had been full time last year and gave exceptional service .
We now have started with an alternative agency.

title: great support from staff at sexual heath clinic
body:
i went to the sexual health clinic because i felt like my IUD might have moved.
i was very stressed by the possibility of the IUD being out of place and needing further treatment & also because i have had very bad experience with gynecology exams in the past (to the point of having PTSD because of what gynecologists/nurses did to me).
i did not know that this clinic had no walk-in and had no appointment booked but the staff managed to find a slot in between patients for me.
the Dr who saw me was very respectful and supportive when i mentioned being so stressed by internal exams.

she was very supportive and respectful during the exam and gave me very clear explanation of the results afterwards. every one that i saw at the clinic was very nice to myself and other patients.

the place seemed very empty, probably because of covid. it felt very safe covid wise with all the distancing and also good for confidentiality (they call you by a number rather than your name, have separate waiting rooms so that not everyone is seeing all other patients).

possible improvements:
- offer all patients up front to chose the size of speculum they want, do STI swab themselves, insert the speculum themselves, be in alternative positions... rather than rely on patient to (know they can) request this.
- put the examining table further away form the wall so that patients can to the "butterfly" with their legs for the exam rather than have feet/legs on stirr ups
- be more mindfull about making patient talk about previous abuse they might have suffered. asking about in the writen would be less distressing for many patients and i would suggest adding a question/box for patient to say if they want to discuss it with professional or not during the appointment so that they don't end up having to answer questions that might distress them if they don't want to on that day, put a question asking if they know where to get support for this and another asking if they want the clinic to provide them with information on where to find support. professionals should realise that this is very distressing to talk about, for some patients this was years ago and they don't need nor want to bring it up every time they go for an appointment, it can make the appointment more difficult as it will get the patient triggered with bad memory from having to speak about it again and also importantly this is patients story so they should not be put on the spot to tell it but be free to decide when they speak about it or not. the answer is not to ask every patients if they have suffered this but to assume most patient have and offer extra sensitive care as default to everyone.
- the registration form had a typo: it said "gender: male/female/non binary" gender is feminine/masculine/non-binary (not male/female).
the staff made this very stressful and triggering time much better by being respectful, compassionate, patient and adaptable.
the opening time of the clinic (all day until 7pm) is very convenient

title: Worst practice
body: Extremely rude receptionist. Struggling with my medical condition trying to contact every single day to make an appointment but get Disappointed with receptionist behaviour. I want to get cure not to get stress by receptionist

title: Kind and caring Practice
body: I have been having a difficult time with a number of rare autoimmune conditions.  I have been looked after by two GPs who, during Covid, have regularly called me to see how I am doing and make helpful suggestions to help with my care.  After each hospital appointment they check in with me to see what happened.  I have been amazed at how proactive, kind and considerate the GPs have been.  HGP is brilliant!

title: No service
body: The practice is simply not fit for purpose. They ask you to fill the online form and then wait for someone to call. The SLA is 48h working days for them to read your request. When they call - they are useless. I went to have virtual consultation with private GP, who gave some recommendations, but recommended me to see my GP f2f for better assessment if MRI scan is needed. Called reception - no, you can't have a f2f appointment, you need to have online consultation with the GP first, even if you had the one already. absolutely and completely useless.

title: Receptionist
body: Had to phone again this week the receptionist was lovely and helpful got a call as she said and an appointment same day she took all information and was very nice not in a hurry and understood my concern this surgery has come under a lot of criticism for different things but can only say am very happy with service today.

title: Dreadful
body: 46 attempts got through 3 times to find im 3 in the queue and when starts ringing get cut off.    This is after listening to a long winded message by a Gp.   Please please make your phone system more patient friendly

title: They don't care
body: Had a very important appointment, they cancelled, without telling me and it's not the first time they've done that. The receptionist fobbed me off when I asked why they hadn't told me. They completely wasted my time and caused me a lot of distress.

title: Review
body: There is always a queue on the phone to book an appointment then when you get through appointments are gone. Physiotherapy services are only supplied at Eccleston - in my case with a delay of several weeks

title: Fantastic service
body:
I have needed to contact my GP twice recently. On the first occasion I rang at 8.30am and a doctor called me back later that morning. I picked up the prescription in the afternoon and the tablets solved the problem almost immediately!
On the second occasion I rang the surgery and due to the nature of the problem I was seen by the nurse the next day and started treatment.
The care given is extraordinary and I am very grateful to everyone at the surgery. Thank you.

title: First class service
body: Recently registered have visited twice. Staff very friendly and helpful. In these difficult times is exactly what you need from GP.

title: They could be great if anyone would answer theâ€¦
body: It is virtually impossible to get in touch with anyone at the Greenfield Centre. Noone ever rings back when they say they will and you end up on hold for hours. I know it is likely underfunded and understaffed but it's so frustrating for anyone struggling with mental health or trying to sort out medications.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Well done for all involved in vaccination center
body:
The long queue was worth it.
Very well organised and very thankful for those who help behind the scenes.
Your all excellent thank you.

title: Brilliant service
body: This friendly practice has been outstanding in their support and treatment for me and my family. Reception staff are patient and helpful and all the clinical staff I have met are professional, gentle, understanding and efficient. Iâ€™ve had a GP go the extra mile on a number of occasions and cannot speak too highly of them all. I consider myself fortunate to be registered with them.

title: Patient Priority is Unbalanced
body:
The Surgery was unable to see my 1yr old son for an emergency appointment after he had been exhibiting symptoms for 4 days. 

The disconnection between 111 and the surgery leaves you confused and unsure with your only options being to go to A&E for any issue.

We are left at a loss as to how to care for our family when the local surgery we rely on is unable to meet the chaotic demands of young children and their parents.

title: Brilliant response
body: Very impressive team when dealing with my complex health issues.I thank all the staff I met on my visit for their incredible support and understanding.They all reassured me at a time when I felt vulnerable and was able to eliminate what worried me most.Thank you!

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I needed to see a doctor about a worrying issue that had developed over the past two weeks. The doctor phoned me back as promised as I saw him later that day. This resulted in a referral there and then for some minor surgery.  For me personally I could not have had a better experience.

title: Excellent
body:
Attended for an X-ray. Super service. Everyone was friendly, helpful and very efficient. Was also in and out very quickly.
Thank you very much.

title: Unsatisfied
body:
Waited nearly  4 hours with our  child to be seen by a nurse who said mum and dad could not both go in to assessment room. After oxygen and temperature both recorded the nurse just needed a Doctor to confirm her assessment and to discharge child, 2 doctors out of 4 both on break so was asked to take a seat in the waiting room again, nearly 4 hours to see a nurse so at this point we left, there seems to be no real urgency with no one going above and beyond, the kind lady on reception did prompt her team after several enquires about how much longer to be seen
On reflection we will try harder to get that illusive doctor's appointment and not trouble A and E again. 
There needs to be an urgent review to see what exactly goes on and to ring the changes in my opinion. 
Thanks.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service
body:
Unable to get any appts. Get told to phone back later and then when do phone back being told they are fully booked. The receptionists havenâ€™t got a clue and seem to just fob you off with excuses or telling you to go see pharmacist instead. 
With GP practises like this being allowed to continue practising the NHS is in very danger of seeing serious casualties

title: Exceptional practice with genuine customer care
body:
Iâ€™ve belonged to this practice for many years now and felt it was time I write a review. 
All the staff from the receptionists to the doctors and nurses truly care for their patients.
My visit today was first class in every way. A lovely lady on the reception - warm, friendly and sincere. Nothing was too much trouble including changing the date of my repeat prescription for this month. 
The nurse I saw today Iâ€™ve seen a few times this year and she always makes me feel at ease. Got to a point now I donâ€™t even notice her taking the blood and we always have a little chat - a very welcome distraction from the needle. 
So exceptional was the service today that the nurse syringed my ears so I didnâ€™t have to come back again later in the week for a further appointment I had booked in.
It should be remembered that all of these incredible staff have had to continue to be customer facing through the pandemic and sadly all too often incredible people like this get forgotten.
So a big shout out for my practice and the incredible team that work there. Thank you!

title: Seems uninterested or uneducated
body: I have PTSD,  restless leg syndrome and now recently diagnosed with ME / chronic fatigue syndrome.  I am constantly ringing up or going to the surgery but I feel that I am not being listened to . I am frustrated I'm.npt getting the help nor the right medication to help make my life easier

title: The staff are kind and helpful, hospital is niceâ€¦
body:
Considering the continuing strain Covid is putting on the hospital, looking after Covid patients, the backlog of patients on long waiting lists because of Covid - who then sometimes become emergency admissions, elderly patients who cannot go to care homes due to a lack of care home staff, I feel the hospital is doing very well.
Thank you for looking after me in my hour if need. Sally Norris

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Never a positive experience
body: Had to contact them over the past few months relating to my baby daughters health and have never had anything like Iâ€™d consider as good service or support. No appointments ever available, either told to call back and then get hung up, or have to wait for days before a telephone consultation. Reception staff leave a lot to be desired in terms of empathy. The one time we did get a face to face appointment for a rash, it was booked in at a different surgery so that involved a drive and a wait at another doctors

title: Let down again
body:
My wife had an appointment sent via text for 09.00;this morning 1Nov 
Booked into surgery via computer at reception and waited at..09.20 
The reception told her to leave as the doctor was not seeing her on the premises,
How are these doctors supposed to treat people if they donâ€™t see them ,
What with being held in a queue for over an hour trying to speak to the reception to make an appointment,
Where is this going to end I wonder?

title: Disgraceful service
body: As a long standing NHS staff member I'm simply appalled!  As with all the other patients who have left a review, I have also tried for hours over a number of days and suffered the same experiences.  Keeping people hanging on the line for 2 hours is nothing short of disgraceful.  I urgently need this scan, as do others, and am at a loss of what to do next.  The thought of ringing again and failing again to get through fills me with despair.  This service 'provider' needs axing!  I'd say it's beyond a joke, but I just feel like crying, not laughing.

title: Dissatisfied
body: I requested a call back from GP, but of the receptionist at this practice was perempory and disissal,causing me great distress.I never did receive a call back.

title: Awful
body:
My wife had an ileostomy in August and was placed with Fittleworth for stoma care. We received an initial supply shortly after she came out of hospital and have been trying ever since to attain more bags etc. We keep having to go to A&E and wait for them to fid us some in the stores, which is a waste of everyone's time and resources.

We call Fittleworth weekly only to be told after the standard hour+ on hold that the GP has not put a prescription in. The GP has showed us all the monthly prescriptions they have sent to Fittleworth. Now four months and aside from one emergency supply they finally sent (bags only, no barriers, adhesive, wipes etc) we have had no joy at all getting them to deliver as promised.

Absolute joke of a company, who really should consider the situation the people they're supposed to be helping are in. We're hoping to get changed to someone else ASAP.

title: No care plan at all just a business now
body:
unsatisfactory service all round for the last 10 yrs 
care profession ? dont think so
long waits on calls short and rude when answered if your lucky
abrupt short front desk clerks
calls not followed up
I would take all my business elsewhere if I were aloud
went a&e in the end 

POOR

title: Brilliant service
body: I phoned on Monday at 8.30 and was number 10 in the queue. The call was answered within 5 minutes by a friendly receptionist. I was told a GP would phone me during the morning and that call came within half an hour. The GP was very supportive and offered me an appointment for the next day. Due to traffic I was 20minutes late for my appointment. I was extremely stressed upon arrival however the receptionist was very kind and caring and I was able to still be seen. The GP was lovely and really listened and I didn't feel rushed. I have been very impressed by the service as a whole which I know is under enormous pressure. Highly recommended them. Thank you.

title: Really happy with this GP
body:
I've been here since 2017 and been really happy with my interactions. Reception staff, doctors, nurses, midwives, all have been lovely and looked after my health as I'd expect of a GP. Would recommend to anyone.
Love the Patient Access app so I can request my repeat prescriptions and then pick them up from the pharmacy a day or two later without having to call or go in. Really great feature!
Like any GP, calling at busy times can be frustrating because so many people want to get in touch, but that's the same at every GP I've been with. I just keep trying and get through eventually.
Parking can be a bit of a pain if the road is busy, but the GP does have a little car park, I just try not to use it so others who may need to more can still park.

title: It was very smooth
body: The appointment was fine, it was very smooth. It was a young lady I sawm she did the tests and it went smoothly and then I received the letter with the results. It just ran smoothly basically.

title: Extremely helpful
body: My therapist was very empathetic and helpful. I've had a massive drop in the amount of anxiety I experience and have developed skills to help me cope when I do become anxious. Life changing stuff.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice.
body: Spent a few hours with you yesterday. From start to finish I felt cared for. A very professional team made the visit as pleasant as any hospital visit can be. Particular thanks go to my surgeon and anaesthetist who I didnâ€™t get to see post op. Many thanks all.

title: Amazing care
body: The staff were really nice and the food was good.  I felt really safe and cared for when it came to being on the children's ward.

title: Excellent Telephone Contact
body:
As one gets older there is a need to speak to the hospital trust for appointments follow ups etc.
I've had many such occasions in recent months.
It's not always easy to get through quickly due to the current situation, however, my experience has been most positive.  The receiption staff, to a one, have been immensely helpful, friendly and professional, all delivered with good humour and courtesy.  Thank you NHS and in particular the superb support staff.

title: All Ok
body: I use Community Eyecare services. I have been to 3 different locations for my appointments, no problems with the clinics or appointments. Staff are all ok, no problems there either.

title: Staff are very nice
body: I have been a patient with Community eye care for over a year for Glaucoma monitoring.  My appointments at the clinics have been fine and the staff are very nice.

title: wonderful service
body: I received minor surgery to my hand which was carried out with extreme care and meticulous skill. The subsequent nursing attention in the following weeks was exemplary. Thank you

title: Communication breakdown!
body:
The service seems to have deteriorated over the years.
Once upon a time, I could call and make an appointment. Even if it wasn't for a week or two.
Now, if I call the practice, a message asks me to 'use the web site for non urgent matters'.
Sounds great - I can send a message, to 'ask a doctor a question'. Brilliant!
And on rare occasions, it has worked very well.
But, most of the time, I can't actually even send a message.
Because, apparently, the service gets 'shut off' every day due to 'capacity' problems.
At which point it is impossible to communicate with the practice.
'Try again tomorrow', I am told.
So I do. Again, and again, and again ...
Yes, I could get on the computer at 7 a.m., and wait for the message service to open, and be at the front of the queue. But it's not an urgent matter. I don't need an appointment today, or tomorrow, or even this week. But I absolutely DO want an appointment in a reasonable time (i.e. within 6 months of asking).
Is that really too much to ask?
Why is there no functional process to deal with 'non urgent' appointments?
I know you're probably very busy; which is why I am being very patient.
But you just seem to be shutting off communications from a large proportion of your patients.
That is really not very good.
So the only option left is to phone and hang on for an answer (and then probably be told that nothing is available).
Surely, the web site is supposed to take the pressure off your phone line. But it seems to be doing the opposite!
And where is your complaints procedure? I can't find anything about it on the web site.
You must surely have a formal process?
Very disappointing.

title: Hit or miss
body: The surgery is very hit or miss in terms of quality. Sometimes you get an appointment really quickly other times you can literally sit on the phone for hours trying to get through only to be told thereâ€™s no appointments. Doctors are generally ok and decent but I have had a few with conflicting opinions on things. Receptionists are again hit or miss. Sometimes you speak to someone lovely who is understanding and really helpful, other times you get some miserable soul who is rude and short which is ironic considering the message at the start of the call states the practice wonâ€™t tolerate any rudeness or abuse. I phoned the other day to request a prescription that wasnâ€™t showing in the app and was told in a short manner â€œUsually we donâ€™t take prescription queries over the phone in order to free up the phone for other peopleâ€. I was thinking hang on for the last 18months youâ€™ve been telling people not to come to the surgery unless absolutely necessary, what else am I supposed to do? I think one of the main issues is that there is too many people in the town for the surgery. They either need to get more staff or have another surgery built. The chemist I havenâ€™t ever had an issue with so no problems there. Overall I think the practice is OK but could be a lot better.

title: Could not care practice
body:
Understaffed dispensary, therefore not providing dispensary requirements.  Also unwilling to allow pharmacies to take over patients dispensing.  Not meeting care of patients.
No Practice Manager, no answers to requests for clarity on how to use the practice re routine appointments, nurses duties for patients and zero treatment for housebound residents.  We have lost our village doctors practice and cannot do anything about it!  As I am typing this I have phone on awaiting to book an appointment. Herewith timings
10th in queue 12.38pm, 8th 12.48 to 1212.58, 7th 12.59 to13.02, 5th at 1.04 4th 1.07 to 1.12, 3rd 1.13, 2nd 1.20 to 1.23pm when my call was answered.

title: Patient care?
body:
Visited the hospital today after sustaining  injuries in a car accident the night before. They were relatively quick in seeing to me (by that I mean it took less than 5 hours which is surprising) however the two practitioners both showed very minimal patient care or sensitivity towards me, the conversation was very clinical and once I was seen, a very basic assessment of my injuries was carried out and I was rushed out in less than 5 minutes. 
The nurse who exported me to the minor injury department rushed ahead of me despite me telling her one of my injuries was my leg and I was showing an obvious limp. A little understanding or maybe even being asked what I was most concerned about would have gone a long way, even if she didnâ€™t have time for me to fully tell her what was hurting.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: This practice is continually getting worse
body:
There is a major decline in the service, if you can call it this, with prescription staff, lacking any kind of understanding, are unhelpful and abrupt. I have been told about this surgery's poor service from other patients as well as the practice manager ignoring emails and messages left and, I have since also experienced this. However, some of the doctors I have had contact with have been understanding and helpful.
However, in order to get to speak to the helpful doctors I, in particular, have had problems with prescription staff and some of the reception staff at Barnard Medical group.  I do hope matters improve during 2022.

title: No care whatsoever.
body:
I called the surgery in the hope of securing a telephone consultation today only to be told there were no appointments and that I'm to call at 8am tomorrow.  I told the member if staff that I had tried to get through this morning but to no avail. I explained what the problem was again to be told in a very unsympathetic manner to try at 8am the following day.
I have called the out of hours GP and have been given an appointment.
It's getting to the point where I need to ring them than my own GP as there are never any appointments and thats if/when you eventually get through on the telephone. 
Unfortunately my original practice was merged with this one, I wish I'd of researched prior to the move as I feel I would not stay with the practice and I will be registering elsewhere.

title: Good Experience
body: I visited here on 01/12 for some blood tests, which I generally donâ€™t do well with, I usually get dizzy and have to wait for a while afterwards. The nurse who did my blood test was really accommodating and talked me through it, allowing me to deal with it how I felt I needed to. I walked out having encountered no issues this time having the bloods done
